org.digijava.kernel.util

Class RequestUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.digijava.kernel.util.RequestUtils

  • public class RequestUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains user-related utility functions. User must be always identified by User object

    • Constructor Summary

      RequestUtils()

    • Method Detail

      • getDigiContextAttribute

        public static java.lang.Object getDigiContextAttribute(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                                       java.lang.String attribute)
        Get attribute from request/tiles context. At first, method searches attribute by key attribute in the tiles context (if it exists for the current request). If search is unsuccessful, then it searches this attribute in the request scope
        Parameters:
        request - HttpServletRequest
        attribute - key of the attribute
        Returns:
        attribute from request/tiles context

      • getDigiContextAttributeEx

        public static <E> E getDigiContextAttributeEx(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                              java.lang.String attribute)
        Get attribute from request/tiles context. Same as above, but with generics. At first, method searches attribute by key attribute in the tiles context (if it exists for the current request). If search is unsuccessful, then it searches this attribute in the request scope
        Type Parameters:
        E -
        Parameters:
        request -
        attribute -
        clazz -
        Returns:

      • setDigiContextAttribute

        public static void setDigiContextAttribute(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                           java.lang.String attribute,
                                           java.lang.Object value)
        Sets attribute into request/tiles context. At first, method checks, does tiles contexst exist or not for the current request. If yes, it puts attribute there. If no, then attribute will be placed in request
        Parameters:
        request - HttpServletRequest
        attribute - key of the attribute
        value - Object to place in the context

      • setTranslationAttribute

        public static void setTranslationAttribute(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                           java.lang.String attribute,
                                           java.lang.String value)
        Sets translation attribute, which will be used by digi:trn tag to assemble formatted translations. For example, if one executes this method with attribute=name, value=Mikheil, then <digi:trn key="..">Hello, {name}</digi:trn> will be rendered as "Hello, Mikheil".
        Parameters:
        request - HttpServletRequest
        attribute - name of the translation attribute
        value - value of the translation attribute

        public static Site getSite(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Returns current site or null, if request does not contain site information
        Parameters:
        request - HttpServletRequest
        Returns:
        current site

        Returns:
        current SiteDomain object

      • setSiteDomain

        public static void setSiteDomain(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                 SiteDomain siteDomain)
        Sets current site domain to request. This method should used internally by DiGi kernel.

        siteDomain - SiteDomain object

        Returns ModuleInstance object, for which request was caled. Return value is the REAL ModuleInstance object, for mapped instances it returns original module instance, not the link.
        Parameters:
        request - request
        Returns:
        ModuleInstance object

      • getSourceURL

        public static java.lang.String getSourceURL(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Get full URL for the current request where "referring back" must be performed. This URL is needed for example, for language switch dropdown, which executed language change action and then redirects back to source URL
        Parameters:
        request - HttpServletRequest object
        Returns:
        full URL for the current request where "referring back" must be performed

      • getRelativeSourceURL

        public static java.lang.String getRelativeSourceURL(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Get relative URL for the current request where "referring back" must be performed. Always starts with "/"
        Parameters:
        request - HttpServletRequest object
        Returns:
        relative URL for the current request

      • getRemoteAddress

        public static java.lang.String getRemoteAddress(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Returns remote host's IP address. If X-Forwarded-For header presents, the first part of it is valid IP and not local, returns it. Otherwise returns IP of the last client (it may be a client's real IP, if there are no proxies, or address of the last proxy in the chain)
        Parameters:
        request - HttpServletRequest object
        Returns:
        remote host's IP address

      • getForwardAddresses

        public static java.lang.String getForwardAddresses(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Returns X-Forwarded-For header data for the request
        Parameters:
        request - X-Forwarded-For header
        Returns:
        X-Forwarded-For header data for the request

      • getForwarderAddress

        public static java.lang.String getForwarderAddress(java.lang.String forwardParam,
                                                   boolean includeLocal)
        Analyzes forwardParam parameter, which contains list of IP addresses, got from HTTP header's X-Forwarded-For parameter and returns first of them, if this is not a local IP address (the last check may be disabled using includeLocal parameter). Local is the address with the following pattern: 0.*.*.*, 127.0.0.1, 192.168.*.*, 172.16.*.*, 10.*.*.*, 224.*.*.*, 240.*.*.*
        Parameters:
        forwardParam - list of IP addresses
        includeLocal - if true - returns IP even if it is the local one
        Returns:
        IP address or null, if it can not be determined

      • getFullModuleUrl

        public static java.lang.String getFullModuleUrl(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Returns root url for the current site with current module name and instance
        Parameters:
        request - HttpServletRequest
        Returns:
        root url for the current site with current module name and instance

      • getSubject

        public static javax.security.auth.Subject getSubject(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Gets Subject from request and returns it. If request does not contain subject, creates new one
        Parameters:
        request - HttpServletRequest object
        Returns:
        Subject from request

        Returns true if development mode is activated. false - if not

        Returns:
        boolean development mode activation status

      • getSiteIdentity

        public static java.lang.String getSiteIdentity(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                               java.lang.String service)
        Returns current site's identity based on configuration setting. If siteIdentityService service is defined in the system, it is asked to calculate identity. If it is not - site's string identity is returned
        Parameters:
        request - HttpServletRequest
        service - String name of the service for which identity should be determined. For example - "google", "omniture",
        Returns:
        site identity

      • getRequestInfo

        public static java.lang.String getRequestInfo(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Returns information (URI, query, cookies, headers, attributes, etc ) about the request, given as parameter
        Parameters:
        request - HttpServletRequest
        Returns:
        String information about the request

      • retreiveSiteDomain

        public static SiteDomain retreiveSiteDomain(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Retreive site domain from request based on calculation. This is usually used in filters when current site is not determined yet.
        Parameters:
        request - HttpServletRequest
        Returns:
        SiteDomain

        Check if the current user is an Admin, if not then the response is redirected to the index page and the method returns false.
